titleStmt.title: [University of Chicago Library GMS-0378, a manuscript catalogue description in electronic form]
titleStmt.funder: Institute of Museum and Library Services

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center

overview.p: Bible in Latin. Portions of the Old and New Testaments include the Octateuch (Genesis - Ruth), the four gospels, Revelation, and the epistles of James, and 1 and 2 Peter. Contains prologues to Joshua, and the gospels of Matthew, Mark, and Luke. Formerly Goodspeed Ms. Lat. 61.

initials.p: Primary initials (20-130 mm) in red, some with penwork of the same color.

watermarks.p: Watermark similar to Briquet 15505, Tête de Cerf sans yeux (Verona 1422-1438).

physDesc.extent: 122 leaves, of which 4 are flyleaves of paper (white and marbled). Flyleaves conjoint with pastedowns.

foliation.p: 2 (unfoliated paper flyleaves) + 118 + 2 (unfoliated paper flyleaves). Foliation in Arabic numerals in ink 1-118.

physDesc.dimensions: Written space 310 x 190 mm (fol. 5r). Each column is 310 x 85 mm with a space of 20 mm between.

layout.p: 2 columns, 51 to 62 lines. Ruling with lead point.

handDesc.p: Written in Roman script in dark brown ink (some fading). Abbreviation throughout. Capitals and strokes, paragraph marks, and marginal notation in red. Lacks opening initials, capitals, titles, and numbers from fol. 113 forward.

textDivisions.p: Running titles and chapter numbers in red.

condition.p: Random water and grease stains. One taped repair.

binding.p: Bound in half red morocco. Title on spine in gilt: Biblia Sacra Latina.

physDesc.secFol: et mortuus est. Vixitque iared sexaginta

origin.p: Written in the 15th century in Italy to judge from the Tête de Cerf sans yeux watermark and the scribal hand.

provenance.p: Late medieval to mid-20th century provenance unknown. Sale catalogue description attached (front pastedown). A handwritten description initialed and dated D.ZV. 9/4/42 is affixed to the front flyleaf (recto). Notation on the back flyleaf (recto) XX/-/-, 23993, 21670, the latter number struck through.

acquisition.p: Gift of Edgar J. Goodspeed, Professor Emeritus in the Divinity School, to the University of Chicago, September 1956, in memory of his wife Elfleda Bond Goodspeed (1880-1949). Purchased by Mr. Goodspeed from Bernard Quaritch Ltd. (London), ca. 1956.

projectDesc.p: The Edgar J. Goodspeed Manuscript Collection contains 68 Greek, Armenian, Latin, Syriac, Ethiopic, and Arabic manuscripts, which range in date from the fifth to the nineteenth century. With support from the Institute of Museum and Library Services National Leadership Grants for Libraries, Building Digital Resources program, the University of Chicago Library has created the online Goodspeed Manuscript Collection, a unique digital resource with manuscripts digitized in their entirety and presented with high-quality zoomable images through an interface that supports browsing within individual manuscripts and across the collection.

Descriptions of the manuscripts have been encoded using the standard set forth in TEI Consortium, eds., TEI P5 Guidelines for Electronic Text Encoding and Interchange: Manuscript Description, at http://www.tei-c.org/release/doc/tei-p5-doc/en/html/MS.html as of 2012-09-22.

The TEI DTD used was obtained from the Digital Scriptorium of Columbia University at, https://www1.columbia.edu/sec/cu/libraries/bts/digital_scriptorium/technical/ds-xml/description_dtd/index.html on 2012-09-22. To accommodate specific project needs, the DTD was edited and extended with local tags in order to describe the content of miniatures, and the structure of canon tables, headpieces, and initials. The process of editing included equating the element Decoration with the seven recognized elements of the TEI Manuscript Description, not only to emphasize intellectual substance, but also to augment visibility by providing links from the record through encoding to the digitized imagery of the Web display.

overview.p: Bible in Latin. Portions of the Old and New Testaments include the Octateuch (Genesis - Ruth), the four gospels, Revelation, and the epistles of James, and 1 and 2 Peter. Contains prologues to Joshua, and the gospels of Matthew, Mark, and Luke. Formerly Goodspeed Ms. Lat. 61.

msItem.incipit: In principio creavit deus celum et terram
msItem.explicit: ...mortuus est expletis centum decem vite sue annis et conditus aromatibus repositus est in loculo in egipto.

msItem.incipit: Hec sunt nomina filiorum ysrael qui ingressi sunt in egiptam cum iacob singuli cum domibus suis introierunt
msItem.explicit: ...Nubes quippe domini incubabat per diem tabernaculo et ignis in nocte videntibus populis israel per cunctas mansiones suas.

msItem.incipit: Vocavit autem moisen et locutus est illi dominus de tabernaculo testimonii dicens
msItem.explicit: ...Hec sunt precepta que mandavit dominus moisi ad filios israhel in monte synai.

msItem.incipit: Locutus est dominus ad moisem in deserto synai in tabernaculo federis prima die mensis secundi Anno altero egressionis eorum ex egipto dicens
msItem.explicit: ...Hec sunt mandata atque iudicia que precepit dominus per manum moysi ad filios israel in campestribus moab super iordanem contra hiericho.

msItem.incipit: Hec sunt verba que locutus est moyses ad omnem israel transiordanem in solitudine campestri contra mare rubrum inter pharan et thopel et laban et aseroth ubi auri est plurimum
msItem.explicit: ...et cunctam manum robustam magnaque mirabilia que fecit moyses coram universo israel.

msItem.incipit: Tanden finita pentatheuco moisi vel ut grandi fenore liberati ad hiesum filium nave manum mittimus quem hebrei iosue filium nun bennun id est filium nun vocant
msItem.explicit: ...et nos ad patriam festinantes mortiferos sirenarum cantus surda debeamus aure transire [Hieronymus, Prol. Iosue, Stegmüller 311].

msItem.incipit: Et factum est post mortem moisi servi domini ut loqueretur dominus ad iosue filium nun ministrum moysi et diceret ei
msItem.explicit: ...Eleazar quoque filius Aaron mortuus est et sepelierunt eum in gaabaath phinees filius eius que data est ei in monte ephraim.

msItem.incipit: Post mortem iosue consuluerunt filii israel dominum dicentes quis ascendet ante nos contra chananeum et erit dux belli
msItem.explicit: ...filii quoque israel reversi sunt per tribus et familias in tabernacula sua. In diebus illis non erat rex in israhel sed unusquisque quod sibi rectum videbatur hoc faciebat.

msItem.incipit: In diebus unius iudicis quando iudices preerant facta est fames in terra. Abiitque homo de bethleem iuda ut peregrinaretur in regione moabitide cum uxore sua ac duobus liberis
msItem.explicit: ...Obed genuit isai. Isai genuit david regem.

msItem.incipit: Matheus ex iudea sicut primus in ordine ponitur ita evangelium in iudea primus scripsit cuius vocatio addeum ex publicanis actibus fuit duorum in generatione christi principia
msItem.explicit: ...fuit et fidem facte rei tradere et operantis dei intellegendam diligenter esse dispositionem querentibus non tacere [Prol. Monarchian, Stegmüller 590].
msItem.incipit: Item alius prologus Matheus cum primo predicasset evangelium in iudea... [Stegmüller 589].
Liber generacionis ihesu christi filii david filii abraam
msItem.explicit: ...docentes eos omnia servare quecumque mandavi vobis. Et ecce ego vobiscum sum omnibus diebus usque ad consumacionem seculi. Amen.

msItem.incipit: Marcus evangelista dei ellectus et petri in babtismate filius atque in divino sermone discipulus sacerdocium in israhel agens secundum carnem levita ad fidem christi conversus evangelium in ytalia
msItem.explicit: ...habentes mercedem exhortacionis quoniam qui plantat et qui rigat unum sunt, qui autem incrementum prestat deus est [Prol. Monarchian, Stegmüller 607].

msItem.incipit: Inicium evangelii ihesu christi filii dei
msItem.explicit: ...Illi autem profecti predicaverunt ubique domino cooperante et sermonem confirmante sequentibus signis.

msItem.incipit: Quoniam quidem multi conati sunt narracionem rerum que in nobis conplete sunt
msItem.explicit: ...ut cognoscas eorum verborum de quibus eruditus es veritatem [Luke 1:1-4 treated as prologue].
msItem.incipit: Lucas syrus natione antiochenus arte medicus discipulus apostolorum postea paulum secutus usque ad confessionem eius
msItem.explicit: ...vitavimus publicam curiositatem, ne non tam demonstrare volentibus deum videremur quam fastidientibus prodidisse [Prol. Monarchian, Stegmüller 620].

msItem.incipit: Fuit in diebus herodis regis iudee sacerdos quidam nomine zacharias de vice abia et uxor illi de filiabus aaron et nomen eius helisabeth
msItem.explicit: ...et erant semper in templo laudantes et benedicentes deum.

msItem.incipit: In principio erat verbum et verbum erat apud deum et deus erat verbum
msItem.explicit: ...Sunt autem et alia multa que fecit ihesus que si scribantur per singula nec ipsum arbitror mundum eos capere posse qui scribendi sunt libros.

msItem.incipit: Apocalipsis yhesu christi quam dedit illi deus palam facere servis suis que oportet fieri cito et significavit mittens per angelum suum servo suo iohanni
msItem.explicit: ...gratia domini nostri iesu christi cum omnibus vobis amen.

msItem.incipit: [I]acobus dei et domini nostri yhesu christi servus duodecim tribubus que sunt in dispersione salutem
msItem.explicit: ...scire debet quoniam qui converti fecerit peccatorem ab errore vie sue salvabit animam eius a morte et cooperit multitudinem peccatorum.

msItem.incipit: [P]etrus apostolus ihesu christi electis advenis dispersionis ponti galaciae cappadocie asie et bithinie
msItem.explicit: ...Salutate invicem in osculo sancto gratia vobis omnibus qui estis in christo amen.

msItem.incipit: [S]imon petrus servus et apostolus iesu christi his qui coequalem nobiscum sortiti sunt fidem in iustitia domini nostri et salvatoris iesu christi
msItem.explicit: ...Crescite vero in gratia et in cognitione domini nostri iesu christi et salvatoris ipsi gloria nun et in die eternitatis amen.

listBibl.bibl:
Friedrich Stegmüller, Repertorium Biblicum Medii Aevi
(Spain: Consejo Superior de Investigaciones Cientificas. Instituto Francisco Suárez, 1950), vol. 1, Initia Biblica: Apocrypha, Prologi.
